results.title: Electric furnaces
results.creator_credit: Frank A. Hoare, Merton Park, British Iron and Steel Federation and John Durst
results.brief_description: Steels for certain special purposes are made in furnaces heated by electricity. This film explains the construction and working of the electric arc and high frequency induction furnaces. Animated diagrams are used to illustrate the chemical reactions in the arc furnace and the principles of induction heating.

results.title: Electric flag
results.brief_description: About the crucial role television and film play in the running of a political campaign. Covers both the making of a candidate and the making of the film “The Candidate”. Points out that in a campaign ‘the general idea is to project energy, warmth, and decisiveness, without saying anything too specific’. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Elections in Britain
results.brief_description: Outline of the British electoral system, taking the General Election of October 1959 as an example. How the local offices in each constituency prepare for the election. Detailed precautions during the ballot and the subsequent counting to maintain secrecy of the vote.

results.title: Elaine Dale: on mine own
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “TV Eye”.
This film is about the inspiring story of Elaine Dale, born without arms - as a result of a side effect of the drug Thalidomide - and now married with one child. Elaine speaks of her own personal struggle to live an independent life while her parents tell of their battle with the drug company for adequate compensation as well as the difficulties encountered in rearing Elaine.

results.title: El Pueblo
results.brief_description: Depicts life in the small community of Villaleunga del Rosario, set high in the mountains of Andalucia in Spain. The village is sustained by the farms which surround it and a modest workshop manufacturing leather goods. The farms are small, often arid and far from the village itself, providing a meagre living from cattle, sheep and goats. But the sense of community is strong, the people’s enduring allegiance and identity being with the village in which they live.

results.title: El Barrio
results.creator_credit: David Sureck, UNICEF and Norton Heilig
results.brief_description: Mario Mendoza, age 7, lives in a city dump in Mexico City. We see a day in Mario’s life. The Mexican Government, with aid from UNICEF, plans to help people-like Mario-who are living in such squalid conditions
